result.execSummary:
The defendant Corvalis M Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Corvalis M Stewart is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Corvalis M Stewart was found guilty of Possession of Firearm by Felon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with ARB.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample-prev provided per DCSO.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

supervisions.notes:
Consec to Federal Case 20CR118. Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: Federal case 20CR118

Info filed; copy to defn; reading waived; Court entered not guilty plea for defendant.  Motions due in 20 days.  Bail continued.
Trial Judge - Br 15
Defendant Corvalis M Stewart in court with attorney David L Mandell. Prosecuting Atty Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Preliminary hearing on August 24, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Corvalis M Stewart in court with attorney David L Mandell. Prosecuting Atty Robert J Jambois appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waived the time limits for the preliminary hearing. Upon agreement of parties, court set date for PH. Bail continued.
Status conference on August 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant in court, in custody.  Robert J Jambois appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not have attorney, does not wish to proceed without counsel. Defendant requests setover. Court finds good cause for setover. Bail to continue.  Status conference scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Alexi R.-B.
- Defendant shall not be at any IHOP restaurants.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 9 p.m. and 6 a.m. 
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 15

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Shaun W O'Connell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
